text: Ringgold County is a county in the U.S. state of Iowa. As of the 2020 census, the population was 4,663, making it the second-smallest population county in Iowa. The county seat is Mount Ayr. The county was founded in February 24, 1847 and named after Maj. Samuel Ringgold, a hero of the Battle of Palo Alto fought in May 1846, during the Mexicanâ€“American War. It is one of the 26 Iowa counties with a name that is unique across the nation. == References == Category:1847 establishments in Iowa Category:Iowa counties
title: Ringgold County, Iowa
